 Resume  for Christian Díaz-Urrutia , PhD   
 
 
 
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIE NCE  
 
Senior Research Engineer [January 2022 – present ];  
Research Engineer [August 2019 – December 2021 ] 
ExxonMobil , Global Research ; Brussels, Belgium  
Tasks:   Responsible for  planning, managing  and executing  all aspects of research and  process 
development pro jects. Specifically, c onducting  fundamental and applied research  on 
heterogeneous and homogeneous catalysts, a dsorbents , and catalytic processes , such as new 
chemical transformation to upgrade  hydrocarbon  feedstocks . I am a member of research  teams 
that span multiple regions (Americas, EU, Asia)  that are  compose d of interdisciplinary members 
(chemists, engineers, business, marketing). As an example of a research project , please see 
press release https://lnkd.in/euz -9hAP  (catalyst  and process development  for propan e 
dehydrogena tion technologies) . Other tasks include : managing a group of approx. seven research 
technicians (MSc, BSc) on laboratory experimentation, spectroscopy and chromatography data 
collection, troubleshooting and SHE related training. Responsible for purchas es of equipment and 
third party services,  HAZOP assessments and post -implementation (training, method setup).  
 
Research Chemist [March 2017 – March 2019 ] 
Grillo -Werke AG , R&D Department, Chemical Division ; Duisburg, Germany  
Tasks: Study of the  sulfonation of metha ne to methan esulfonic acid and recycling of fluorocarbons 
under superacid conditions ; scale -up process to a pilot plant setting; handle corrosive and 
explosive mixtures; prepare patents and scientific publications.  
 
Start -up Co -founder [March  2016  – March 2017 ] 
Hopperide Inc. ; Ottawa, Canada  
Tasks:  Implementation from zero -to-one of every aspect of a technological start -up; business 
development, software coding, financing, customer engagement, etc.  
 
ACADEMIC HISTORY  
 
PhD Chemistry  
[January 2011 – October 2016]  
University of Ottawa  
Research Supervisor:  Prof. R. Tom Baker  
Thesis : Design, Synthesis and Characterization of New Inorganic Base Metal Catalysts for the 
Aerobic Oxidation of Lignin Models and Lignin Extracts.  
 
Bachelor of Science in Chemistry  
[March 2006 – December 2009]  
Universidad de Chile   
Research Supervisor:  Prof. Claudio Olea -Azar 
Thesis : Biological and Chemical Study of Tetracyclic Nitroindazole with Important Antiparasite 
Effects.

 CORE COMPETENCIES  
 
Managing complex research projects  (ideation,  prioritization,  execution ), translating vision 
from business into research solutions , intellectual property  drafting , pilot plant construction 
and operation  (eg., reactors up to 4 gallons, 120 barg , and 7.5 m distillation columns) . 
 
Managing and training laboratory technician s in air-sensitive techniques, high -throughput 
techniques, pressure reactors, vac uum distillations, handling highly c orrosive and explosive 
mixtures, reporting out data, and SHE trainings for nobody gets  hurt policy.  
 
Expertise in data a cquisition and interpretation of  homogeneous and heterogeneous catalyst 
characterization ( X-ray diffraction, NMR, FT -IR, BET, SEM, TEM, etc), and catalytic process 
development and optimization (online GC, HPLC,  NMR,  etc). 
 
Inventor  on eight patent application s and author of ei ght peer -reviewed publications. Over twenty 
three international conference presentations . 
 
Languages:  Bilingual in English and Spanish . 
 
RESEARCH INTERSHIPS  
 
Alexandre Martinez’s Research Group,  ENS Lyon; France  [May 2015] , R. Tom Baker’s Research 
Group, University of Ottawa  [September 2010 – December 2010] ; Tito Scaiano’s  Resea
